reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Other Services - Contract Advisory and Assistance Service Individual Experts and Consultants. INL/CAP Training & Justice Team Program Assistant. INL/KM Training & Justice Team Program Assistant. Miscellaneous/Other Contractual Services - Other Contractual Services NOC. Information has been Redacted in accordance with the two principled exceptions of the Foreign Aid Transparency and Accountability Act (FATAA) of 2016; including the health and security of implementing partners, as well as national interest of the United States.

description.narrative: Supports the following illustrative program-funded costs: salaries of US, FSN, and TCN and other staff such as PSCs, RSSAs, PASAs, CASUs working for the US Government managing, administering, and supporting programs and their program-funded benefits such as housing, travel, transportation, education allowances etc; institutional contractors that provide such staff, rent, IT services, the program-funded share of utilities, staff training costs and the cost of developing and administering training programs, equipment and supplies, ICASS, vehicle fuel and maintenance, maintenance contracts, janitorial services, operational unit web page development and maintenance, outreach such as publications and the cost of their preparation (including staff costs), and technical assistance to ensure USG compliance with regulations.

This award strives to help foreign partners professionalize their military forces through educational programs and technical support, ensuring that their force can develop and maintain the requisite capacity to effectively carry out its military mission through reliance on discipline, accountability, effective professional standards, and technical expertise. More specifically, this includes Covers individual experts and consultants possessing special, current knowledge, and skill which may be combined with extensive operational experience. They provide information, opinions, advice, or recommendations that enhance understanding of complex issues or improve the quality and timeliness of policy development and decision-making. Contract experts and consultants do not supervise or perform operating functions nor do they receive direct supervision. Contract experts and consultants serving on advisory committees are to be assigned to subobject code 2505.. Covers miscellaneous contractual services such as A&E contracts and IT site preparation by the PBA, GSA, and commercial contracts, among other things.. CRIMINAL JUSTICE ASSISTANCE & PARTNERSHIP. BPA Call modification to administratively and temporarily increase Labor Hours and Travel/ODCs in order to replace the funds under accounting ref #2 in the amount of $60,351.20, for the services of a Training and Partnership Program Assistant supporting INL/KM/CET in Washington, D.C. CIVILIAN POLICE PROGRAM. IAW FAR 4.804-4, BPA Call modification to de-obligate all un-liquidated funding in the amount of $81,261.41and physically complete and closeout, IAW with the release of claims from the vendor, for the services of a Training and Partnership Program Assistant supporting INL/KM/CET in Washington, D.C.. CRIMINAL JUSTICE ASSISTANCE & PARTNERSHIP[Management and professional support services generally aim at improving the efficiency or effectiveness of management or administrative systems and normally take the form of information, opinion, advice, training or direct assistance. Contracts may be with firms or individuals.]. CRIMINAL JUSTICE ASSISTANCE & PARTNERSHIP[Covers individual experts and consultants possessing special, current knowledge, and skill which may be combined with extensive operational experience. They provide information, opinions, advice, or recommendations that enhance understanding of complex issues or improve the quality and timeliness of policy development and decision-making. Contract experts and consultants do not supervise or perform operating functions nor do they receive direct supervision. Contract experts and consultants serving on advisory committees are to be assigned to subobject code 2505.]. Management and professional support services generally aim at improving the efficiency or effectiveness of management or administrative systems and normally take the form of information, opinion, advice, training or direct assistance. Contracts may be with firms or individuals.. BPA Call modification, IAW FAR 52.217-8, Extend Option Year (OY) 04 for six (06) months until 05/25/2020 in the amount of $60,351.20 for services of a Training and Partnership Program Assistant located in Washington, D.C.. Information has been redacted in accordance with the two principled exceptions defined in the Foreign Aid Transparency and Accountability Act (FATAA) of 2016: the health and security of implementing partners, and the national interest of the United States..

Through educational programs and technical support, help foreign partners professionalize their military forces, ensuring that their force can develop and maintain the requisite capacity to effectively carry out its military mission through reliance on discipline, accountability, effective professional standards, and technical expertise. In addition, activities assist foreign partners so that their military forces reliably demonstrate consistent support for adherence to norms of human rights; support the concept of civilian executive authority/control of the military; and have the capacity for institutional and security sector reform.
